result.execSummary:
Stephen Patrick Lyp was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Stephen Patrick Lyp was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen Patrick Lyp

records.addlTxt: Letter to Governor Tony Evers in re:  Certified Copy of Waiver of Extradition
Recitals and Waiver of Extradition Pursuant to 976.03 Wis Stats /s/ TBE 02/22/22

01:04 PM Defendant Stephen Patrick Lyp in court, in custody. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Defendant appears without counsel today.
Matter is set for extradition hearing.
State has copy of the complaint and extradition should we get to that point.
Defendant has an outstanding warrant in Washington County Minnesota.

Atty Pfeil addresses the Court further.

State provides paperwork to Defendant, copy of complaint and warrant.
Court sees an extradition complaint and copy of warrant from Minnesota.

Court questions Defendant.
Defendant does not contest, waives his right to extradition, wants to get this taken care of right away.
Defendant understands the demand made from Minnesota for his surrender.

Court informs Defendant his right to an attorney.
Defendant understands.
Defendant would like to proceed today, does not wish to obtain an attorney.

Court questions Defendant further. Defendant replies.
Defendant still wishes to waive his right to extradition.

Defendant has a waiver form in front of him and understands each statement.
Defendant signs the form.

Court questions Defendant.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waiving his right to extradition and procedure.
Court grants the waiver.

Defendant is given a copy of the form.

DA was in contact with the Sheriff Dept in Portage County and was confirmed that Minnesota still wants him and will come and get him.
Copy of Warrant from State of Minnesota, Washington County
Extradition Hearing to be held on February 22, 2022 at 1:00 p.m. in Br 1
